content: this is a summary of a legal text regarding a mutual consent divorce agreement between mr vt and mrs b b they have decided to proceed with a divorce and have requested a settlement of property agreements the notary has informed them of their rights and obligations and prepared a draft deed for their review the parties have confirmed their understanding of the draft and have the option to read the entire deed belgian law applies to the divorce an inventory of assets will be created to determine distribution the spouses have made arrangements regarding their movable and immovable property including financial accounts cars securities life insurance policies and inheritances they have discussed the treatment of taxes fees and liabilities related to the property the text also addresses the custody management of property and personal contact arrangements for their two minor children the parents have agreed on primary residence visitation rights decisionmaking authority and financial contributions for the children the text mentions the distinction between ordinary and extraordinary costs and the possibility of adjusting the agreement based on new circumstances the parties have waived maintenance payments and will share the costs of the legal proceedings the jurisdiction for the proceedings is determined based on the last marital residence or current domiciles the family court in antwerp has jurisdiction in this case the notarys clerk has signed a deed on behalf of the parties confirming the condition precedent for the allocation of property the notary has verified the parties identities and the accuracy of their personal details a fee was paid for the preparation of the documents the deed was sent to the parties in advance and any changes were communicated the parties signed the deed at the notarys office
